snippet: R. A. Dickey took a shutout into the ninth inning, and two relievers sealed his fourth victory.
abstract: New York Mets defeat Arizona Diamondbacks, 3-1. Photo (M)Ç
lead_paragraph: Mets starter R. A. Dickey hurled the rosin bag at the mound, disgusted with himself despite emphatic applause from the 29,107 fans at Citi Field. Dickey was three outs from a shutout, but he had to settle for his fourth victory of the season when Manager Terry Collins removed him after he allowed a run-scoring double in the ninth. ''It leaves a sour taste in my mouth simply because I knew I have an expectation of myself in that situation, and that is not it,'' Dickey said Sunday after the Mets' 3-1 victory over the Arizona Diamondbacks. ''Sometimes when I don't meet that expectation, it's tough to swallow, even in the midst of a good outing.''

headline.main: Tough on Batters; Harder on Himself
